text: Iron(II) fumarate, also known as ferrous fumarate, is the iron(II) salt of fumaric acid, occurring as a reddish-orange powder, used to supplement iron intake. It has the chemical formula 424. Pure ferrous fumarate has an iron content of 32.87%, therefore one tablet of 300 mg iron fumarate will contain 98.6 mg of iron (548% Daily Value based on 18 mg RDI). ==Iron supplement== Ferrous fumarate is often taken by mouth as an iron supplement. ==See also== *Iron - Nutrition Category:Iron(II) compounds Category:Dietary minerals Category:Coordination compounds Category:Fumarates Category:Antianemic preparations
title: Iron(II) fumarate
